Nonnegativity of the dot product of a vector with itself.

lemma dotProduct_self_nonneg {n : Nat} (v : Fin n Real) : 0 v v := by classical -- `v v = i, v i * v i`. simpa [dotProduct] using (Finset.sum_nonneg (s := Finset.univ) (f := fun i : Fin n => v i * v i) (fun i _hi => mul_self_nonneg (v i)))

lemma range_term_quadraticHalfInner_le (n : Nat) (x xStar : Fin n Real) : ((x xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfInner n x quadraticHalfInner n xStar := by classical -- First prove the real inequality `x,x* (1/2)x,x + (1/2)x*,x*` by summing -- `2ab a^2 + b^2` componentwise. have h2 : 2 * (x xStar : Real) (x x) + (xStar xStar) := by have hsum : (Finset.univ.sum fun i : Fin n => 2 * (x i * xStar i)) Finset.univ.sum fun i : Fin n => x i * x i + xStar i * xStar i := by refine Finset.sum_le_sum ?_ intro i _hi have : 0 (x i - xStar i) ^ 2 := sq_nonneg (x i - xStar i) nlinarith [this] -- Rewrite both sides back into dot products. -- Left: ` 2*(x_i*x*_i) = 2 * (x_i*x*_i)`. -- Right: ` (x_i^2 + (x*_i)^2) = x_i^2 + (x*_i)^2`. simpa [dotProduct, Finset.mul_sum, Finset.sum_add_distrib, mul_assoc, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm] using hsum have hreal : (x xStar : Real) - (1 / 2 : Real) * (x x) (1 / 2 : Real) * (xStar xStar) := by linarith [h2] -- Cast the real inequality into `EReal` and normalize the expression. have hE : (((x xStar : Real) - (1 / 2 : Real) * (x x) : Real) : EReal) (((1 / 2 : Real) * (xStar xStar) : Real) : EReal) := by exact_mod_cast hreal -- Rewrite the goal into the coerced real inequality above. simpa [quadraticHalfInner, EReal.coe_sub, EReal.coe_mul, mul_assoc, mul_left_comm, mul_comm] using hE

The Fenchel conjugate of is itself.

lemma fenchelConjugate_quadraticHalfInner (n : Nat) : fenchelConjugate n (quadraticHalfInner n) = quadraticHalfInner n := by classical ext xStar unfold fenchelConjugate refine le_antisymm ?_ ?_ -- Upper bound: every range term is bounded by `w(x*)`. refine sSup_le ?_ rintro y x, rfl exact range_term_quadraticHalfInner_le n x xStar -- Lower bound: evaluate the supremum at the maximizer `x = x*`. have hle : ((xStar xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfInner n xStar sSup (Set.range fun x : Fin n Real => ((x xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfInner n x) := le_sSup xStar, rfl have hterm : ((xStar xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfInner n xStar = quadraticHalfInner n xStar := by -- `x*,x* - (1/2)x*,x* = (1/2)x*,x*`. set a : Real := (xStar xStar : Real) have ha : a - (1 / 2 : Real) * a = (1 / 2 : Real) * a := by ring calc ((xStar xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfInner n xStar = ((a : Real) : EReal) - (((1 / 2 : Real) * a : Real) : EReal) := by simp [quadraticHalfInner, a] _ = ((a - (1 / 2 : Real) * a : Real) : EReal) := by exact (EReal.coe_sub a ((1 / 2 : Real) * a)).symm _ = (((1 / 2 : Real) * a : Real) : EReal) := by exact_mod_cast ha _ = quadraticHalfInner n xStar := by simp [quadraticHalfInner, a] -- Conclude by rewriting with `hterm`. simpa [hterm] using hle

Text 12.2.9: The fixed-point identity for Fenchel conjugation has a unique solution in the class of convex functions on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n, namely Unknown identifier `f`sorry = sorry : Propf = Unknown identifier `w`w where . theorem fenchelConjugate_eq_self_unique_solution (n : Nat) : (ConvexFunction (quadraticHalfInner n) fenchelConjugate n (quadraticHalfInner n) = quadraticHalfInner n) f : (Fin n Real) EReal, ConvexFunction f fenchelConjugate n f = f f = quadraticHalfInner n := by refine ?_, ?_ exact convexFunction_quadraticHalfInner n, fenchelConjugate_quadraticHalfInner n intro f _hfConvex hfFix -- First show `w f` from the fixed-point identity. have hwle : x : Fin n Real, quadraticHalfInner n x f x := quadraticHalfInner_le_of_fenchelConjugate_eq_self n f hfFix -- Conjugation reverses order, so `f = f* w* = w`. have hanti := fenchelConjugate_antitone (n := n) have hfle : x : Fin n Real, f x quadraticHalfInner n x := by intro x have := hanti (a := quadraticHalfInner n) (b := f) hwle x -- Rewrite using `f* = f` and `w* = w`. simpa [hfFix, fenchelConjugate_quadraticHalfInner n] using this -- Conclude by pointwise antisymmetry. funext x exact le_antisymm (hfle x) (hwle x)

Rewriting a dot product after applying the inverse linear equivalence, using the assumed adjoint relation.

lemma dotProduct_linearEquiv_symm_eq (n : Nat) (A AStar : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (hAStar : x y : Fin n Real, (A x) y = x AStar y) (y v : Fin n Real) : (A.symm y) v = y AStar.symm v := by -- Apply the adjoint identity to `x = A y` and `y = (A*) v`, then simplify. simpa using (hAStar (A.symm y) (AStar.symm v)).symm

Theorem 12.3. Let Unknown identifier `h`h be a convex function on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n, and define , where Unknown identifier `A`A is a one-to-one linear transformation of ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n, Unknown identifier `a`a and are vectors in ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n, and failed to synthesize Membership ?m.1 Type Hint: Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.Unknown identifier `` . aStar)) + ((xStar a : Real) : EReal) + ((- - (a aStar) : Real) : EReal)) = fenchelConjugate n h (AStar.symm (xStar - aStar)) + ((xStar a + (- - (a aStar)) : Real) : EReal) := by simp [add_assoc, EReal.coe_add] -- ` - (xStara + *) = + - a(xStar-a*)`. have h' : ( - (xStar a + (- - (a aStar)) : Real) : Real) = ( + - (a (xStar - aStar)) : Real) := by -- Use commutativity of the dot product to match the book's `ax*` notation. simp [sub_eq_add_neg, dotProduct_comm] ring -- Apply cancellation for `EReal` addition by a real. -- First rewrite to the single-constant form, then cancel. simpa [hadd, h', add_assoc] using (ereal_add_coe_le_coe_iff_cancel (t := fenchelConjugate n h (AStar.symm (xStar - aStar))) (c := (xStar a + (- - (a aStar)) : Real)) ( := )) -- The left-hand side inequality is equivalent to the shifted inequality for `h*`. have hshift : (fenchelConjugate n (fun x => h (A (x - a)) + ((x aStar : Real) : EReal) + ( : EReal)) xStar ( : EReal)) fenchelConjugate n h (AStar.symm (xStar - aStar)) (( + - (a (xStar - aStar)) : Real) : EReal) := by simpa using (fenchelConjugate_affineTransform_le_coe_iff (n := n) (h := h) (A := A) (AStar := AStar) hAStar (a := a) (aStar := aStar) ( := ) (xStar := xStar) ( := )) -- Combine the equivalences. constructor intro h have := (hshift).1 h exact (hcancel).2 this intro h have := (hcancel).1 h exact (hshift).2 this

Simplify the Fenchel-conjugate range term for a Tucker-type partial affine function.

Outside the primal constraint set, the function value is : ?m.1 and the range term is : ?m.1.

lemma range_term_partialAffine_tucker_simp (n m : Nat) (00 : Real) (0 : Fin n Real) (i0 : Fin m Real) ( : Fin m Fin n Real) (x xStar : Fin (n + m) Real) : let f : (Fin (n + m) Real) EReal := fun y => if _ : ( i : Fin m, y (Fin.natAdd n i) = ( j : Fin n, i j * y (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) then (( j : Fin n, 0 j * y (Fin.castAdd m j) - 00 : Real) : EReal) else (((x xStar : Real) : EReal) - f x) = if _ : ( i : Fin m, x (Fin.natAdd n i) = ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) then ((x xStar - ( j : Fin n, 0 j * x (Fin.castAdd m j) - 00) : Real) : EReal) else := by classical dsimp by_cases hx : ( i : Fin m, x (Fin.natAdd n i) = ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) -- Feasible: subtracting a real value stays finite. simp [hx] -- Infeasible: subtracting `` yields ``. simp [hx]

Expand the real expression for a Tucker-type partial affine function under the primal feasibility constraint, grouping the free coordinates Unknown identifier `x`x (Fin.castAdd m ).

lemma range_term_partialAffine_tucker_real_formula (n m : Nat) (00 : Real) (0 : Fin n Real) (i0 : Fin m Real) ( : Fin m Fin n Real) (x xStar : Fin (n + m) Real) (hx : i : Fin m, x (Fin.natAdd n i) = ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) : let xHead : Fin n Real := fun j => x (Fin.castAdd m j) let coeff : Fin n Real := fun j => xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j let const : Real := 00 - ( i : Fin m, i0 i * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) x xStar - ( j : Fin n, 0 j * xHead j - 00) = ( j : Fin n, xHead j * coeff j) + const := by classical dsimp -- Split the dot product into head and tail sums, and rewrite the tail coordinates using `hx`. have hdot : x xStar = ( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * xStar (Fin.castAdd m j)) + ( i : Fin m, (( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by simp [dotProduct, Fin.sum_univ_add, hx] -- Separate the tail sum into the part linear in the head variables and the constant part. have htail : ( i : Fin m, (( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) = ( i : Fin m, ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - ( i : Fin m, i0 i * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by simp [sub_mul, Finset.sum_sub_distrib] -- Swap the order of summation in the bilinear term. have hswap : ( i : Fin m, ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) = j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by -- Expand the inner sum and swap, then factor out the head coordinate. calc ( i : Fin m, ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) = i : Fin m, j : Fin n, ( i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i) := by refine Finset.sum_congr rfl ?_ intro i _hi simpa [mul_assoc] using (Finset.sum_mul (s := Finset.univ) (f := fun j : Fin n => i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) (a := xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))) _ = j : Fin n, i : Fin m, ( i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i) := by simpa using (Finset.sum_comm (s := (Finset.univ : Finset (Fin m))) (t := (Finset.univ : Finset (Fin n))) (f := fun i j => ( i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))) _ = j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by refine Finset.sum_congr rfl ?_ intro j _hj -- Factor `x (Fin.castAdd m j)` out of the sum over `i`. calc ( i : Fin m, ( i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) = i : Fin m, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * ( i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by refine Finset.sum_congr rfl ?_ intro i _hi simp [mul_left_comm, mul_comm] _ = x (Fin.castAdd m j) * ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by simpa using (Finset.mul_sum (a := x (Fin.castAdd m j)) (s := Finset.univ) (f := fun i : Fin m => i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))).symm -- Assemble and group by head variables. calc x xStar - ( j : Fin n, 0 j * x (Fin.castAdd m j) - 00) = (( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * xStar (Fin.castAdd m j)) + ( i : Fin m, (( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) - i0 i) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))) - ( j : Fin n, 0 j * x (Fin.castAdd m j) - 00) := by simp [hdot] _ = (( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * xStar (Fin.castAdd m j)) + (( i : Fin m, ( j : Fin n, i j * x (Fin.castAdd m j)) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - ( i : Fin m, i0 i * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)))) - ( j : Fin n, 0 j * x (Fin.castAdd m j) - 00) := by simp [htail] _ = (( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * xStar (Fin.castAdd m j)) + ( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))) - ( i : Fin m, i0 i * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))) - ( j : Fin n, 0 j * x (Fin.castAdd m j) - 00) := by simp [hswap, sub_eq_add_neg, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm] _ = (( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * (xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j)) + (00 - ( i : Fin m, i0 i * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)))) := by -- Group the head sums and collect the remaining constant term. ring_nf -- Normalize the grouped head sum using linearity of ``. -- The remaining goals are purely about distributing multiplication over addition/subtraction. simp [Finset.sum_add_distrib, sub_eq_add_neg, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm, mul_comm] _ = ( j : Fin n, x (Fin.castAdd m j) * (xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j)) + (00 - ( i : Fin m, i0 i * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i))) := by rfl

The dual feasibility constraint in Tucker form is equivalent to vanishing of the coefficients of the free primal variables in the conjugate range term.

lemma tucker_dualConstraint_iff_coeff_eq_zero (n m : Nat) (0 : Fin n Real) ( : Fin m Fin n Real) (xStar : Fin (n + m) Real) : let coeff : Fin n Real := fun j => xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j ( j : Fin n, xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) = ( i : Fin m, (- i j) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) + 0 j) ( j : Fin n, coeff j = 0) := by classical dsimp constructor intro hxStar j -- Substitute the dual constraint and simplify the coefficient. calc xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j = (( i : Fin m, (- i j) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) + 0 j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j := by simp [hxStar j] _ = ( i : Fin m, (- i j) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by ring _ = 0 := by simp intro hcoeff j -- Extract the equality `xStar_head = 0 - * tail` from `coeff j = 0`. have h0 : xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) + ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) - 0 j = 0 := hcoeff j have hx : xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) = 0 j - ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := by linarith [h0] -- Rewrite the right-hand side as a sum over `(-)`. calc xStar (Fin.castAdd m j) = 0 j - ( i : Fin m, i j * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) := hx _ = ( i : Fin m, (- i j) * xStar (Fin.natAdd n i)) + 0 j := by simp [sub_eq_add_neg, add_comm]

If some coefficient in a linear form is nonzero, we can choose the variables to make the form arbitrarily large (even achieving any prescribed value up to a constant shift).

lemma exists_head_makes_linear_combo_arbitrarily_large {n : Nat} (coeff : Fin n Real) (const : Real) (hcoeff : j : Fin n, coeff j 0) : : Real, xHead : Fin n Real, ( j : Fin n, xHead j * coeff j) + const := by classical intro rcases hcoeff with j, hj let t : Real := ( - const) / coeff j refine fun k : Fin n => if k = j then t else 0, ?_ have hsum : ( k : Fin n, (if k = j then t else 0) * coeff k) = t * coeff j := by simp have ht : t * coeff j = - const := by dsimp [t] field_simp [hj] -- Conclude by computation. have : ( k : Fin n, (if k = j then t else 0) * coeff k) + const = := by calc ( k : Fin n, (if k = j then t else 0) * coeff k) + const = (t * coeff j) + const := by simp _ = ( - const) + const := by simp [ht] _ = := by ring exact le_of_eq this.symm
end Section12end Chap03
